english: Taiwanese beverage chain Xing Fu Tang

etymology.description: 幸福 (happiness; blessing) + 堂 (hall; shop) = “hall of happiness” (brand name).
etymology.interpretation: Evokes a welcoming establishment where happiness is offered through sweet drinks, using the classic 商号 suffix 堂 common in Chinese shop names. Suggests that visiting the shop brings good fortune and joy.

parts.english: hall; main room; reception hall; shop (in store names)

examples.chinese: 我们去幸福堂买珍珠奶茶(我們去幸福堂買珍珠奶茶)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qù Xìngfú Táng mǎi zhēnzhū nǎichá.
examples.english: We’re going to Xing Fu Tang to buy bubble milk tea.

examples.chinese: 幸福堂在很多城市都有分店(幸福堂在很多城市都有分店)。
examples.pinyin: Xìngfú Táng zài hěn duō chéngshì dōu yǒu fēndiàn.
examples.english: Xing Fu Tang has branches in many cities.

examples.chinese: 他们的黑糖珍珠很有名(他們的黑糖珍珠很有名)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de hēitáng zhēnzhū hěn yǒumíng.
examples.english: Their brown sugar pearls are well known.
